content.text:
# Draft:Balloranking

= Balloranking =
Balogun Olamilekan (born 20 November 1997), known professionally as Balloranking, is a Nigerian singer, songwriter, and record producer. He is associated with street-pop and Afropop styles and is signed to Lormy Entertainment and Dvpper Music.
File:WhatsApp Image 2025-08-08 at 23.48.16 8dfcc02d.jpg|alt=|[https://profileability.com/balloranking/]
Early Life
Balloranking was born and raised in the Coker area of Surulere, Lagos State. He grew up in a musical household; his father served as a choir conductor, which exposed him early to music and sparked his interest in pursuing it professionally.[https://musicbiography.com.ng/balloranking-biography/] He began his musical journey around age seventeen while working as a graphic designer his boss’s frequent musical playing motivated him to create his own music.
Career
Balloranking gained recognition in the early 2020s with several singles, including "Time No Dey" (featuring Seyi Vibez), "Holiday" (featuring Small Doctor), and "Never Die Trying" . In 2021, he released his debut album Zero Panic, followed by the EP Trench Kid in 2022, which featured collaborations with Seyi Vibez, Bad Boy Timz, Lyta, and Bella Shmurda.
In September 2023, Balloranking released his album Ghetto Gospel, marking a significant career milestone. The album, produced under Dvpper Music, expanded his sound and audience reach with tracks like "We Up" (featuring D’Yani), "Hustle Hard", and "Alive", earning widespread digital traction.
Balloranking's music blends Afro-soul, hip-hop, and Lagos street music a style often referred to as "street pop" or "street ballad", characterized by its vivid storytelling, melodic hooks, and colloquial expression. Publications highlight his authenticity, emotional depth, and connection to Lagos street culture as defining aspects of his artistry.
Discography
Albums / EPs
Zero Panic (2021)
Trench Kid (EP, 2022)
Ghetto Gospel (2023)
Balloranking Zero Panic, Vol. 2 (2024)
Selected Singles
Included among others: "Time No Dey", "Holiday", "Never Die Trying", "Realize", "We Up", "Hustle Hard", "Alive" .
